query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 Di pari, come buoi che vanno a giogo, 2 m’andava io con quell’ anima carca, 3 fin che ’l sofferse il dolce pedagogo.
query.result: 1 In the same way, like oxen that go yoked, 2 I went with that burdened soul, 3 until the gentle teacher endured it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
7 dritto sì come andar vuolsi rife’mi 8 con la persona, avvegna che i pensieri 9 mi rimanessero e chinati e scemi.
query.result: 7 Straightway, as one who is eager to go, 8 I set out with my body, although my thoughts 9 remained behind, bowed down and weakened.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 Io m’era mosso, e seguia volontieri 11 del mio maestro i passi, e amendue 12 già mostravam com’ eravam leggeri;

Please translate each line literally into English.
13 ed el mi disse: «Volgi li occhi in giùe: 14 buon ti sarà, per tranquillar la via, 15 veder lo letto de le piante tue».
query.result: 13 and he said to me: "Turn your eyes downward: 14 it will be good for you, to make the way easier, 15 to see the bed of your own feet."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
16 Come, perché di lor memoria sia, 17 sovra i sepolti le tombe terragne 18 portan segnato quel ch’elli eran pria,
query.result: 16 As, in order that memory of them may be, 17 earthen tombs above the buried dead 18 bear a sign of what they were before,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
19 onde lì molte volte si ripiagne 20 per la puntura de la rimembranza, 21 che solo a’ pïi dà de le calcagne;

Please translate each line literally into English.
22 sì vid’ io lì, ma di miglior sembianza 23 secondo l’artificio, figurato 24 quanto per via di fuor del monte avanza.
query.result: 22 so I saw there, but of better semblance 23 according to the artistry, depicted 24 as much as projects outward from the mountain.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
25 Vedea colui che fu nobil creato 26 più ch’altra creatura, giù dal cielo 27 folgoreggiando scender, da l’un lato.
query.result: 25 I saw the one who was created noble 26 more than any other creature, come down from heaven 27 thundering, on one side.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
28 Vedëa Brïareo fitto dal telo 29 celestïal giacer, da l’altra parte, 30 grave a la terra per lo mortal gelo.
query.result: 28 I saw Briareus, pierced by the celestial 29 thunderbolt, lying on the other side, 30 weighing down the earth with his mortal frost.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
31 Vedea Timbreo, vedea Pallade e Marte, 32 armati ancora, intorno al padre loro, 33 mirar le membra d’i Giganti sparte.
query.result: 31 I saw Apollo, I saw Pallas and Mars, 32 still armed, around their father, 33 gazing at the scattered limbs of the Giants.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
34 Vedea Nembròt a piè del gran lavoro 35 quasi smarrito, e riguardar le genti 36 che ’n Sennaàr con lui superbi fuoro.
query.result: 34 I saw Nimrod at the foot of the great work, 35 as if bewildered, and gazing at the people 36 who in Shinar with him were proud.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
37 O Nïobè, con che occhi dolenti 38 vedea io te segnata in su la strada, 39 tra sette e sette tuoi figliuoli spenti!
query.result: 37 O Niobe, with what grieving eyes 38 I saw you depicted on the road, 39 between your seven and seven slain children!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
40 O Saùl, come in su la propria spada 41 quivi parevi morto in Gelboè, 42 che poi non sentì pioggia né rugiada!
query.result: 40 O Saul, how on your own sword 41 you seemed dead there on Gilboa, 42 which afterward felt neither rain nor dew!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
43 O folle Aragne, sì vedea io te 44 già mezza ragna, trista in su li stracci 45 de l’opera che mal per te si fé.
query.result: 43 O foolish Arachne, so I saw you 44 already half spider, sadly on the tatters 45 of the work that was ill done for you.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
46 O Roboàm, già non par che minacci 47 quivi ’l tuo segno; ma pien di spavento 48 nel porta un carro, sanza ch’altri il cacci.
query.result: 46 O Rehoboam, it does not seem here 47 that your sign threatens; but full of terror 48 a chariot bears it, without anyone pursuing it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
49 Mostrava ancor lo duro pavimento 50 come Almeon a sua madre fé caro 51 parer lo sventurato addornamento.
query.result: 49 The hard pavement also showed 50 how Almeoon made his mother pay dearly 51 for the ill-fated adornment.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
52 Mostrava come i figli si gittaro 53 sovra Sennacherìb dentro dal tempio, 54 e come, morto lui, quivi il lasciaro.
query.result: 52 It showed how the sons threw themselves 53 on Sennacherib inside the temple, 54 and how, after killing him, they left him there.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
55 Mostrava la ruina e ’l crudo scempio 56 che fé Tamiri, quando disse a Ciro: 57 «Sangue sitisti, e io di sangue t’empio».
query.result: 55 It showed the ruin and the cruel slaughter 56 that Tomyris inflicted when she said to Cyrus: 57 "You thirsted for blood, and I fill you with blood."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
58 Mostrava come in rotta si fuggiro 59 li Assiri, poi che fu morto Oloferne, 60 e anche le reliquie del martiro.
query.result: 58 It showed how the Assyrians fled in rout 59 after Holofernes was killed, 60 and also the remnants of the slaughter.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
61 Vedeva Troia in cenere e in caverne; 62 o Ilïón, come te basso e vile 63 mostrava il segno che lì si discerne!

Please translate each line literally into English.
64 Qual di pennel fu maestro o di stile 65 che ritraesse l’ombre e ’ tratti ch’ivi 66 mirar farieno uno ingegno sottile?
query.result: 64 What master of brush or pen 65 could portray the shadows and the lines that there 66 would make a subtle mind marvel?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
67 Morti li morti e i vivi parean vivi: 68 non vide mei di me chi vide il vero, 69 quant’ io calcai, fin che chinato givi.
query.result: 67 The dead seemed dead and the living seemed alive: 68 no one who saw the truth ever saw more than I, 69 as I trod, until I went bent over.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
70 Or superbite, e via col viso altero, 71 figliuoli d’Eva, e non chinate il volto 72 sì che veggiate il vostro mal sentero!
query.result: 70 Now be proud, and go with haughty face, 71 children of Eve, and do not bow your head 72 so that you may see your evil path!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
73 Più era già per noi del monte vòlto 74 e del cammin del sole assai più speso 75 che non stimava l’animo non sciolto,
query.result: 73 More of the mountain was already turned toward us 74 and much more of the sun's course was spent 75 than my unfree mind had reckoned,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
76 quando colui che sempre innanzi atteso 77 andava, cominciò: «Drizza la testa; 78 non è più tempo di gir sì sospeso.

Please translate each line literally into English.
79 Vedi colà un angel che s’appresta 80 per venir verso noi; vedi che torna 81 dal servigio del dì l’ancella sesta.
query.result: 79 See there an angel who is preparing 80 to come toward us; see that the handmaid of the sixth hour 81 is returning from her service of the day.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
82 Di reverenza il viso e li atti addorna, 83 sì che i diletti lo ’nvïarci in suso; 84 pensa che questo dì mai non raggiorna!».

Please translate each line literally into English.
85 Io era ben del suo ammonir uso 86 pur di non perder tempo, sì che ’n quella 87 materia non potea parlarmi chiuso.
query.result: 85 I was well accustomed to his admonitions, 86 just so as not to waste time, so that in that 87 subject he could not speak to me obscurely.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
88 A noi venìa la creatura bella, 89 biancovestito e ne la faccia quale 90 par tremolando mattutina stella.
query.result: 88 The beautiful creature was coming toward us, 89 clothed in white, and in his face such 90 as the morning star appears, trembling.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
91 Le braccia aperse, e indi aperse l’ale; 92 disse: «Venite: qui son presso i gradi, 93 e agevolemente omai si sale.

Please translate each line literally into English.
94 A questo invito vegnon molto radi: 95 o gente umana, per volar sù nata, 96 perché a poco vento così cadi?».
query.result: 94 To this invitation very few of us come: 95 O human race, born to fly upward, 96 why do you fall at so little wind?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
100 Come a man destra, per salire al monte 101 dove siede la chiesa che soggioga 102 la ben guidata sopra Rubaconte,
query.result: 100 As on the right hand, to climb the mountain 101 where the church sits that overlooks 102 the well-guided city beyond Rubaconte,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
103 si rompe del montar l’ardita foga 104 per le scalee che si fero ad etade 105 ch’era sicuro il quaderno e la doga;

Please translate each line literally into English.
106 così s’allenta la ripa che cade 107 quivi ben ratta da l’altro girone; 108 ma quinci e quindi l’alta pietra rade.

Please translate each line literally into English.
109 Noi volgendo ivi le nostre persone, 110 ‘Beati pauperes spiritu!’ voci 111 cantaron sì, che nol diria sermone.
query.result: 109 We, turning our persons there, 110 heard voices singing "Beati pauperes spiritu!" 111 in a way that no speech could describe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
112 Ahi quanto son diverse quelle foci 113 da l’infernali! ché quivi per canti 114 s’entra, e là giù per lamenti feroci.
query.result: 112 Ah, how different those entrances are 113 from the infernal ones! For here one enters to the sound of songs, 114 and down there to savage lamentations.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
115 Già montavam su per li scaglion santi, 116 ed esser mi parea troppo più lieve 117 che per lo pian non mi parea davanti.
query.result: 115 Now we were climbing the holy stairs, 116 and it seemed to me that I was much lighter 117 than I had seemed on the plain before.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
118 Ond’ io: «Maestro, dì, qual cosa greve 119 levata s’è da me, che nulla quasi 120 per me fatica, andando, si riceve?».
query.result: 118 Whereupon I said: "Master, tell me, what heavy thing 119 has been lifted from me, that I feel almost 120 no fatigue in walking?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
121 Rispuose: «Quando i P che son rimasi 122 ancor nel volto tuo presso che stinti, 123 saranno, com’ è l’un, del tutto rasi,
query.result: 121 He replied: "When the P's that are left 122 still on your face, almost erased, 123 will be, like the one, completely erased,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
124 fier li tuoi piè dal buon voler sì vinti, 125 che non pur non fatica sentiranno, 126 ma fia diletto loro esser sù pinti».
query.result: 124 your feet will be so conquered by good will 125 that not only will they feel no fatigue, 126 but it will be a delight for them to be urged upward."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
127 Allor fec’ io come color che vanno 128 con cosa in capo non da lor saputa, 129 se non che ’ cenni altrui sospecciar fanno;

Please translate each line literally into English.
130 per che la mano ad accertar s’aiuta, 131 e cerca e truova e quello officio adempie 132 che non si può fornir per la veduta;

Please translate each line literally into English.
133 e con le dita de la destra scempie 134 trovai pur sei le lettere che ’ncise 135 quel da le chiavi a me sovra le tempie:
query.result: 133 and with the fingers of my right hand, one by one, 134 I found indeed the six letters that he of the keys 135 had incised on my temples:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
136 a che guardando, il mio duca sorrise.
query.result: 136 at which, looking, my leader smiled.
